english_translation: Narrated by Yunus ibn Halbs: I went out with Abu Said al-Zurqi, the Companion of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, to purchase sacrificial animals. Abu Said pointed to a ram of middle quality, neither too high nor too low in value, and said: Buy this for me, as if he was likening it to the ram of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ.

narrators.name: Duhayim
narrators.full_name: Duhaym ibn Muhammad ibn al-Walid al-Shami

narrators.name: Abu Said al-Zurqi
narrators.full_name: 'Abdullah ibn Mas'ud ibn Sa'id al-Durri al-Zurqi

chainIssues: Muhammad ibn Shu'ayb is rated Saduq (trustworthy but not at highest level of precision) - not the most reliable narrator in the chain
Yunus ibn Halbs uses direct transmission term (نا) from the Companion, indicating direct hearing

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn Shu'ayb is Saduq rather than Thiqah
potential_issues.impact: This moderately reliable narrator reduces the overall reliability of the chain from 'Sound' to 'Acceptable' level

potential_issues.issue: Hadith is maqtu' (disconnected) - does not contain a statement attributed to Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
potential_issues.impact: The hadith is Yunus ibn Halbs narrating what he witnessed with Abu Said al-Zurqi when buying a sacrificial animal. This is a report of an incident, not a teaching from the Prophet ﷺ

Topics: Incident of purchasing sacrificial animal with Abu Said al-Zurqi
Description of animal quality for sacrifice

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Said al-Khayar: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: Perform ablution from what the fire has touched and what the pots have boiled.

narrators.name: Duhayim
narrators.full_name: Duhaym ibn Muhammad ibn al-Walid al-Shami

narrators.name: al-Walid ibn Sulayman
narrators.full_name: al-Walid ibn Sulayman ibn Abi al-Saib al-Basri

narrators.name: Abu Said al-Khayar
narrators.full_name: 'Abdullah ibn Mas'ud ibn Sa'id al-Durri al-Zurqi
narrators.alternative_names: Abu Said al-Khayar, Abu Said al-Zurqi

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn 'Abdullah ibn 'Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Al-Walid ibn Muslim is known as a mudallis (concealor of sources) classified as Category 2 by Ibn Hajar - he uses direct transmission term (ثنا), which is acceptable even if he practices tadlis of lower category
Firas al-Sha'bani uses 'an (عَنْ) which is ambiguous transmission term, though he is considered reliable (La Ba'sa Bihi)
Abu Said al-Khayar uses 'an (عَنْ) instead of a direct transmission term, creating slight ambiguity, though as a Companion he is the most trustworthy

potential_issues.issue: Al-Walid ibn Muslim is a known mudallis (Category 2) but uses direct transmission term
potential_issues.impact: While al-Walid ibn Muslim practices tadlis, his use of direct transmission term (ثنا) is acceptable. Category 2 mudallis are generally accepted even with ambiguous transmission terms. This does not significantly affect the hadith's reliability

potential_issues.issue: Firas al-Sha'bani uses 'an (عَنْ) transmission term
potential_issues.impact: The ambiguous transmission term introduces slight uncertainty about the connection between Firas and the next narrator. However, Firas is generally reliable (La Ba'sa Bihi), so this is not a major concern

potential_issues.issue: Multiple Saduq-level narrators in the chain (al-Walid ibn Muslim and al-Walid ibn Sulayman)
potential_issues.impact: The presence of two Saduq narrators reduces the overall quality of the chain below the highest standards

Topics: Pots and boiling water in ablution rulings

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Said al-Ansari al-Khayar that the Prophet ﷺ said: From my nation, seventy thousand will enter Paradise, such that they include the muhajirin (emigrants), and a portion of it will be from our bedouins.

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn 'Awf
narrators.alternative_names: Muhammad ibn Awf, Qudamah ibn Wabrah

narrators.name: Abd al-Hamid ibn Ibrahim
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn al-Hasan ibn Ahmad al-Sabbagh
narrators.alternative_names: Abd al-Hamid al-Isfahani, Abu Bakr al-Thaqafi

narrators.name: Qays ibn al-Harith
narrators.alternative_names: Qays ibn al-Harith, Ali ibn al-Husayn

narrators.name: Abu Said al-Ansari al-Khayar
narrators.full_name: 'Abdullah ibn Mas'ud ibn Sa'id al-Durri al-Zurqi
narrators.alternative_names: Abu Said al-Ansari, Abu Said al-Khayar

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn 'Abdullah ibn 'Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Multiple narrators use 'anna (أَنَّ) transmission term: Qays ibn al-Harith and Abu Said al-Ansari both use 'anna, which indicates indirect transmission
Multiple Saduq-level narrators appear in the chain: Muhammad ibn Awf, Abd al-Hamid ibn Ibrahim, Abdullah ibn Salim, Abu Imran Abdullah ibn Amir, and Qays ibn al-Harith
Al-Zubaidi uses 'an (عَنِ) which is ambiguous transmission term

potential_issues.issue: Multiple 'anna (أَنَّ) transmission terms appear late in the chain (Qays ibn al-Harith and Abu Said al-Ansari)
potential_issues.impact: The use of 'anna from Qays ibn al-Harith and from Abu Said al-Ansari to the Prophet ﷺ creates ambiguity about whether these reports are direct or indirect. This reduces the reliability from 'Sound' to 'Acceptable' level

potential_issues.issue: Five narrators in the chain are Saduq (trustworthy but not at highest precision level)
potential_issues.impact: The presence of multiple Saduq narrators indicates this is not a hadith with the strongest possible chain. The reliability is at acceptable rather than sound level

potential_issues.issue: Al-Zubaidi uses 'an (عَنِ) with indirect transmission term
potential_issues.impact: This ambiguity in transmission term adds to the overall concerns about the chain quality

Topics: Seventy thousand from the Ummah entering Paradise
Bedouins from the Ummah entering Paradise
Promise of salvation to the Ummah

english_translation: Narrated by a man from the Ansar named Nadrah: I married a virgin girl while she was in seclusion (pregnant), and when I came to her, she was pregnant. The Prophet ﷺ said: She has the dower for what you have made lawful of her private part, and the child is a slave for you. When she gives birth, (some specific ruling is mentioned).

narrators.name: al-Hasan ibn Ali al-Hulwani
narrators.full_name: al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Muhammad al-Hulwani
narrators.alternative_names: Abu Muhammad al-Hulwani, Abu Hilal al-Akki

narrators.name: Ibn Jurayj
narrators.full_name: 'Abd al-Malik ibn 'Abd al-'Aziz ibn Jurayj al-Qurashi

narrators.name: Said ibn al-Musayyib
narrators.full_name: Sa'id ibn al-Musayyib ibn Hazn al-Qurashi al-Umayyad

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn 'Abdullah ibn 'Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Ibn Jurayj is known as a mudallis (Category 3) who conceals his sources, but here uses direct transmission term (نا) which is acceptable
Safwan ibn Sulaym and Said ibn al-Musayyib both use 'an (عَنْ) ambiguous transmission terms
Al-Hasan ibn Ali al-Hulwani is Saduq, not the highest grade of reliability

potential_issues.issue: Ibn Jurayj is a known mudallis but uses direct transmission term
potential_issues.impact: While Ibn Jurayj practices tadlis, his use of direct transmission (نا) is generally acceptable. This does not significantly reduce reliability

potential_issues.issue: Multiple ambiguous transmission terms (عَنْ) from Safwan and Said ibn al-Musayyib
potential_issues.impact: The use of 'an from two consecutive narrators adds some ambiguity, though both are reliable narrators

potential_issues.issue: Al-Hasan ibn Ali al-Hulwani is Saduq, not Thiqah
potential_issues.impact: The opening narrator being Saduq reduces the chain quality to Acceptable rather than Sound

potential_issues.issue: The concluding text of the hadith appears potentially problematic
potential_issues.impact: The final ruling attributed to the Prophet ﷺ requires careful scholarly examination to ensure textual accuracy

Topics: Incident of pregnant woman marrying a man
Legal status of a child from such marriage
Ruling on pregnant women and marriage

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Shaybah al-Khudri: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: Whoever says 'There is no god but Allah' with sincere heart will enter Paradise. Abu Shaybah died in the land of the Romans, and we buried him.

narrators.name: al-Hasan ibn Ali al-Hulwani
narrators.full_name: al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Muhammad al-Hulwani
narrators.alternative_names: Abu Muhammad al-Hulwani, Abu Hilal al-Akki

narrators.name: Mishrass's Father
narrators.full_name: Khalid ibn Muhammad ibn Khalid ibn Maymun

narrators.name: Abu Shaybah al-Khudri
narrators.full_name: Yazid ibn Harun ibn Zādhan ibn Thabit al-Wasiti

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn 'Abdullah ibn 'Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Yunus ibn al-Harith is classified as Da'if (weak narrator) - this significantly impacts chain reliability
Mishrass's father is also classified as Da'if (weak narrator)
Mishrass is classified as Majhul (unknown) in terms of reliability - only one narrator reports from him

potential_issues.issue: Yunus ibn al-Harith is classified as Da'if (weak narrator)
potential_issues.impact: A weak narrator in the middle of the chain significantly reduces the hadith's authenticity. This moves the hadith from Acceptable to Problematic category

potential_issues.issue: Mishrass's father is also Da'if (weak narrator)
potential_issues.impact: Another weak narrator further reduces reliability. The hadith becomes Problematic

potential_issues.issue: Mishrass is Majhul (unknown reliability) - only reported from him
potential_issues.impact: Majhul status adds to the chain's weakness, though less severe than having weak narrators

Topics: Sincerity in faith and entering Paradise
Companion Abu Shaybah al-Khudri and his death in Roman lands

english_translation: Narrated by Ghaziyyah ibn al-Harith: He heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ saying: There is no hijrah after the conquest (of Makkah). Rather, it is (comprised of) three: struggle (jihad), gathering (for judgment), and intention (niyyah).

narrators.name: al-Hasan ibn Ali al-Hulwani
narrators.full_name: al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Muhammad al-Hulwani

narrators.name: Abd al-Samad ibn Abd al-Warith
narrators.full_name: Abd al-Samad ibn Abd al-Warith al-Hamdani

narrators.name: Abdullah ibn Rafi'
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Rafi' Mawla Umm Salamah
narrators.alternative_names: Abdullah ibn Rafi', mawla of Um Salamah

narrators.name: Ghaziyyah ibn al-Harith
narrators.alternative_names: Ghaziyyah ibn al-Harith, Issam ibn Sayf

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn 'Abdullah ibn 'Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Multiple Saduq narrators in the chain: Said ibn Salamah, Yazid ibn Khusayfah, Abdullah ibn Rafi'
Multiple ambiguous transmission terms (عَنْ): Said ibn Salamah, Yazid ibn Khusayfah, Abdullah ibn Rafi'
Ghaziyyah ibn al-Harith uses 'anna (أَنَّهُ) which indicates indirect transmission

narrators.name: al-Hasan ibn Ali al-Hulwani
narrators.full_name: al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Muhammad al-Hulwani

narrators.name: Abdullah ibn Rafi'
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Rafi' Mawla Umm Salamah
narrators.alternative_names: Abdullah ibn Rafi', mawla of Um Salamah

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn 'Abdullah ibn 'Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Second chain has multiple Saduq narrators: Abdullah ibn Salih, Khalid ibn Yazid, Said ibn Abi Hilal, Yazid ibn Khusayfah, Abdullah ibn Rafi'
Multiple ambiguous transmission terms (عَنْ): Said ibn Abi Hilal, Yazid ibn Khusayfah, Abdullah ibn Rafi', and Ghaziyyah ibn al-Harith
Both chains converge at Yazid ibn Khusayfah and Abdullah ibn Rafi', showing multiple recensions of the same hadith

potential_issues.issue: Both chains contain multiple Saduq-level narrators
potential_issues.impact: The presence of multiple Saduq narrators in both chains reduces overall reliability from Sound to Acceptable level

potential_issues.issue: First chain uses 'anna (أَنَّهُ) from Ghaziyyah indicating indirect transmission
potential_issues.impact: The indirect transmission term creates ambiguity about the connection between Ghaziyyah and the Prophet ﷺ

potential_issues.issue: Multiple ambiguous transmission terms (عَنْ) in both chains
potential_issues.impact: The cumulative effect of multiple 'an transmissions reduces clarity of the transmission path

potential_issues.issue: Two chains exist for this hadith showing variant versions
potential_issues.impact: The existence of multiple recensions indicates the hadith was transmitted through different paths with varying reliability levels

Topics: Cessation of Hijrah after the Conquest of Makkah
Three pillars after the Conquest: struggle (jihad), resurrection (hashr), and intention (niyyah)
Stages and rulings regarding migration in Islam
